
# Introduction

![youtube] (https://youtube.com/shorts/JgX6QBDlIYk?si=5mTz7QfO862n-aVC)

Image processing involves analyzing and manipulating images using algorithms. It is used in medical imaging, computer vision, robotics, and multimedia applications.

## Common Techniques

### 1. Image Enhancement

- Adjusting contrast and brightness
- Histogram equalization
- Noise reduction (Gaussian blur, median filter)

![image](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
### 2. Image Segmentation

- Thresholding (Otsu's method)
- Edge detection (Canny, Sobel)
- Watershed algorithm

![image](data:image/jpeg;base64,)


### 3. Morphological Operations

- Erosion and dilation
- Opening and closing
- Skeletonization

![image](data:image/png;base64,)


### 4. Feature Extraction

- Corner detection (Harris, Shi-Tomasi)
- SIFT (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform)
- HOG (Histogram of Oriented Gradients)

![image](https://kaamraan.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/plot_hog_1.png)

### 5. Image Transformation

- Fourier Transform
- Wavelet Transform
- Hough Transform


![image](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRZ26O0NtKf9G4r9t_cheQDO2T8co7nkJq4Dg&s)

## Tools and Libraries

- OpenCV (python)
- MATLAB
- TensorFlow/Keras (for deep learning-based processing)
 

## Conclusion
Image processing is essential in various fields. Choosing the right techniques and tools depends on the problem at hand. Mastering image processing requires understanding both theoretical concepts and practical implementations.
